description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a VsCode "code.exe" process. This could indicate an attempt of persistence via VsCode tasks or terminal profiles.
author: Nasreddine Bencherchali
false_positives: In development environment where VsCode is used heavily. False positives may occure when developers use task to compile or execute different types of code. Remove or add processes accordingly
name: VsCode Child Process Anomaly
query: (process.parent.executable.text:*\\code.exe AND ((process.executable.text:(*\\calc.exe OR *\\regsvr32.exe OR *\\rundll32.exe OR *\\cscript.exe OR *\\wscript.exe)) OR ((process.executable.text:(*\\powershell.exe OR *\\pwsh.exe OR *\\cmd.exe) AND process.command_line.text:(*Invoke\-Expressions* OR *IEX* OR *Invoke\-Command* OR *ICM* OR *DownloadString* OR *rundll32* OR *regsvr32* OR *wscript* OR *cscript*))) OR (process.executable.text:(*C\:\\Users\\Public\\* OR *C\:\\Windows\\Temp\\* OR *C\:\\Temp\\*))))
